name: The Flotsam Pools
tagline: Willows hang over dreary swampland. The occasional sound of waves, as if an ocean were nearby.

procedural.encounter_notes: Daytime encounters are 1-in-6 likely to be with Tekwell Onehorn
procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d3 portions of Hag's Tears and 1d2 portions of Marshwick, in addition to the normal results

description: Willows hang over dreary swampland. The occasional sound of waves, as if an ocean were nearby.

points_of_interest.name: Flotsam Pools
points_of_interest.description: Scattered throughout this section of the swamp are small pools of dark, brackish water. No apparent bottom to these pools can be seen.
points_of_interest.exploring: Chance of flooding: The pools are always swollen after heavy rain; otherwise there is a 2-in-6 chance that they are flooding when the PCs encounter them. When flooded: A random PC must make a Dexterity Check or plunge into one of the pools with a loud splash. Roll for a random encounter, attracted by the noise. Flotsam: When the pools flood, strange objects and unknown species of fish (among them—inexplicably—oceanic ones) sometimes wash up on the muddy banks. Their true provenance is unknown.
special_features: Dexterity Check or fall in when flooded

points_of_interest.name: Tekwell's Hut
points_of_interest.description: A rickety stilt house constructed from willow wood and thatching stands alone in the south-east corner of the hex.
points_of_interest.interior: A sparse single room with mismatched wooden walls and floors, where rot and water damage have been cut away. Its furniture appears fashioned by someone of below-average skill. Next to a reed bed is a large trunk containing 380sp, 185cp, and dozens of small trinkets made of semi-precious metals, all aquatic-themed (200gp total).
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Tekwell Onehorn, who has a 3-in-6 chance of being present. If not, he is out travelling the swamp.

roll_tables.name: Tekwell's Wares
roll_tables.description: For sale: Tekwell has an assortment of oddities dredged from the pools, which he is willing to sell. Roll up to 4 times, ignoring duplicate results over 8.

entries.description: A thin, leathery fish with enormous teeth. Technically edible. (1gp)
A brown, bulbous anglerfish. While its light gland is submerged in water, it produces a 10′ radius glow. (10gp)
A 3′-long eel with a thin body and an enormous head. Delicious if cooked properly. (10gp)
A sealed jar of water containing a bloated red fish that explodes harmlessly if removed. (20gp)
entries.mechanical_effect: Explodes harmlessly if removed from water

entries.description: A tiny octopus with a golden ring pattern. Lethal if consumed (Save Versus Doom). (10gp)
entries.mechanical_effect: Save Versus Doom if consumed or die

entries.description: An empty stone bowl. If lifted to one's lips, the holder experiences the sensation of drinking fresh water. (50gp)
entries.mechanical_effect: Provides sensation of drinking fresh water

entries.description: A tightly sealed copper locket stylised as a fish eye. If pried open, it contains a lock of hair matching the colour and texture of one of the PCs. (10gp)

A cursed bronze Ring of Water Walking in the shape of a mermaid holding her own tail. If the wearer is ever submerged in water, they must Save Versus Spell or be compelled to stop moving and let themselves drown. (100gp)
entries.mechanical_effect: Water walking; Save Versus Spell when submerged or compelled to drown

entries.description: A small leather case, swollen shut. Inside is a set of eight hematite statuettes of fish-headed humanoids (worth 50gp each). (20gp for the closed case)

npcs.name: Tekwell Onehorn
npcs.description: An elderly longhorn fisherman with dirty white fur and sickly yellow eyes. Wears a wide-brimmed straw hat with a single large hole cut out for his left horn. The right horn was broken off near the base and refuses to regrow. Once a knight to the previous Lord Murkin, he was banished years ago by the current Lord Murkin for a perceived lack of loyalty.
demeanor: Cautious but agreeable if approached respectfully
Has the social grace of someone who speaks with real people only a few times a year
Doffs and dons his hat frequently
desires: To only have short, pleasant interactions with people
For visitors to stop asking if he's secretly a banished prince
secrets: Once a knight to the previous Lord Murkin
Banished by current Lord Murkin for perceived lack of loyalty
possessions: Assortment of oddities dredged from the pools
